column4: Hi.  Trying to configure eth1 on a first time ubuntu-server install.  Can anyone help?
ifconfig only shows eth0.  unsure how to configure ubuntu network devices.
Is there a tool or howto?
sudo network-admin (usually do the trick)
cool. thx.
what package installs network-admin?
i think it is a part of gnome....
if you made a server-install for ubuntu then you will not have network-admin. but as a standard install it will be there.
thus the question on what package would provide it. :)
i will have to go in just a minute so unfortunatley i do not have the time to check... :-/
k.np.
xdm is not in /usr/lib. it work anyway
so "no" it should not exist.

my problem, is that it is not working.  I get what looks like 3 errors.  The first is the missing libXdmGreet.so. Followed by xdm error: Server for display echo terminated unexpectedly: 1  and then followed by xdm error: Unknown session exit code2304 from process 5357
i just tried xdm today and it works fine. try to re-install it. and in /etc/rc2.d/ create a symlink for xdm as S20xdm
you can also try S99xdm if it hangs.
k.  Have done all that.  no go.  thx. though.
strange. since i'm using ubuntu 5.10 as you do. tested with both 386 and 686 versions
I am assuming that you did a full install?  I did a server and added the same packages that made 5.04 work w/ xdm but it doesnt work on 5.10.
yes
well, that tells me I am missing something but no idea what yet.  Guess I will reload 5.04 and get it working again and output a package list to compare.
thx for the help.
np
